messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] Polish
messages.msgSnippet: HI dont do it. you could damage the blade easily if you dont know what your doing. you may spend a few pounds/dollars on a some polish and it may look good to
messages.messageBody:
HI

dont do it.

you could damage the blade easily if you dont know
what your doing.

you may spend a few pounds/dollars on a some polish
and it may look good to you, but infact you may
permanently damage the surface of the balde and know
100's or even 1000's of the value of the blade.

if it only needs a little touch up hand polish then I
would only recommend an impregnated wadding to clean,
such as Duraglit (UK mtal polish) other than that I
would save some money and send to areal polisher
Paul


--- tsukaboku <eiroku24@...> wrote:


---------------------------------
Does anyone know of any good steel polish, i found an
old katana
that i must have bought at a collector store (not
real) its a little
dull looking and i want it to look better just
something so it looks
better on the stand
